discussion.content: Should be A & D. When it says an installement meets of the selection criteria, it means invoice validation is one of the met criterias.

A E

The reasons are as follows:
• Rejected by approver
• Withholding tax calculation error
• Credit reduces payment amount below zero
• Invoice needs revalidation
• Invoice requires approval
• Invoice never validated
• Payment date in closed period
• Payment date before system date not allowed
• Installment on hold
• Supplier site on payment hold
• Installment manually removed
• Zero amount installments excluded

choices.D: The pay-through date is in a closed Payables period.
choices.C: The pay-through date is in a future period.
choices.B: The invoice has not been accounted.

questions.question_text: An installment meets all of the selection criteria of a Payment Process Request but it still did not get selected for payment processing. Identify two reasons for this.

Your intercompany transaction type is active and enabled for invoicing. What are the two prerequisites to generate intercompany receivables and intercompany payable transactions after the Generate Intercompany Allocations process is run?

discussion.content: A. Run the process Transfer Intercompany transactions to Receivables and Transfer Intercompany transaction to Payables. And C

choices.B: For the Legal Jurisdiction, Legal function "Generate intercompany invoice" should be assigned.
choices.F: Run the processes Create Intercompany transactions to Receivables and Create Intercompany transactions to Payables.
choices.A: Run the process Transfer Intercompany transactions to Receivables and Transfer Intercompany transaction to Payables.
choices.E: Schedule create accounting for the intercompany process.
choices.D: Manual Approvals should be allowed for the transaction type.
choices.C: Supplier site primary pay flag and customer account bill to primary flag should be enabled.

questions.question_text:
After you submitted a Payment Process Request, you noticed errors. You want to void the payments.
Identify two statements that indicate when it is not possible to void a payment.

choices.D: A payment that has been accounted and posted to General Ledger.
choices.A: A payment with the status of Issued.
choices.E: A payment that pays a prepayment that has been applied to an invoice.
choices.B: A payment that has already cleared the bank.
choices.C: A payment for an invoice with an associated Withholding Tax invoice.

discussion.content: Answer need to be only B

questions.question_text: Which component is not included in the security architecture for credit card data and bank account data encryption?

discussion.content:
E is correct, the security architecture consists of the following components :
Payment Master Encryption Key
Oracle Wallet
Payment Subkeys
Sensitive data encryption and storage
B and E both seem correct

The security architecture for credit card data and bank account data encryption is composed of the following components:

OPSS
Payments master encryption key
Payments subkeys
Sensitive data encryption and storage

questions.question_text:
An installment for $2,000 USD is due for payment on July 31, 2016. The installment has two discounts: the first discount date is June 15, 2016 for $150 USD and the second discount date is June 30, 2016 for $50 USD.
You submit a Payment Process Request with the following criteria:
- Payment Date = June 20, 2016
- Pay Through Date = July 30, 2016
- Date Basis = Due Date
What will be the resulting status of the installment and discount?

discussion.content:
C. The installment is not selected because the due date is after the Pay Through Date.

Reason: The Pay Through Date determines the installment selection
C. The installment is not selected because the due date is after the Pay Through Date.(need to Check)

choices.A: The installment is selected and a discount of $150 USD is applied.
choices.E: The installment is not selected because the discount dates are before the Pay Through Date.
choices.C: The installment is not selected because the due date is after the Pay Through Date.
choices.D: The installment is selected and no discount is applied.
choices.B: The installment is selected and a discount of $50 USD is applied.
